info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 6:35PM EDT until June 26 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
info.description:
Thunderstorms have been nearly stationary over the advisory area for the last hour, but are expected to gradually weaken over the next hour or so.
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Cypress Lake, Harlem Heights, Villas, McGregor, San Carlos Park, Iona, Three Oaks, Fort Myers Villas, Whiskey Creek and Punta Rassa. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING
